name: Eurasian Watermilfoil

Identifying Characteristics: Stems: long, abundantly branched, reddish or olive-green
Leaves: Finely feather divided, 12-24 leaflet pairs, whorls of 3-6 leaves, tips blunt, internodal space 1cm or more
Flowers: June to September, in whorls on emergent stalk with bracts (smooth margins), flowers larger than bracts, tiny, white, female has not petals, male has 4 petals
Fruits/Seeds: up to 3mm diameter, divided into 4 chambers, 1 seed per chamber
Biology: Primary reproduction: root division, fragmentation, seeds
Habitat: Extremely adapted – still and flowing waters
Variety of substrates – fine-textured to inorganic
Range: Northeast US Range: most states including Maine, also most Canadian provinces including Quebec

tags: plants with finely-divided leaves on stems
